meanings.definition: The act of getting off a ship or aircraft.
meanings.sent1: The disembarkations from the cruise ship were smooth and organized.
meanings.sent2: Passengers waited patiently for the disembarkations at the airport.
meanings.sent3: The penguins decided to have a race during the disembarkations from the boat.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the disembarkations from the plane resembled a flock of birds scattering.
meanings.sent5: The loudspeaker announcement made the disembarkations feel urgent and important.

meanings.definition: The process of unloading passengers or cargo from a vehicle.
meanings.sent1: The disembarkations of the luggage took longer than expected.
meanings.sent2: The crew efficiently handled the disembarkations of the goods from the truck.
meanings.sent3: During the disembarkations of the boxes, one accidentally fell into the river.
meanings.sent4: The disembarkations of the supplies onto the dock were met with cheers from the workers.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the forklift signaled the start of the disembarkations of the equipment.

meanings.definition: The act of leaving a mode of transportation.
meanings.sent1: The disembarkations from the train station were chaotic during rush hour.
meanings.sent2: Passengers were reminded to check their belongings before the disembarkations from the bus.
meanings.sent3: The clown entertained the children during the disembarkations from the circus train.
meanings.sent4: The sudden stop signaled the unexpected disembarkations from the rollercoaster.
meanings.sent5: The captain announced the disembarkations from the ship with a loud horn blast.
